knowledge_base.solution: The issue was resolved by correcting the mapping problem in the dashboard configuration. Additionally, a specific team member was assigned responsibility to monitor the dashboard regularly to ensure it remains up to date and that data recency issues are detected promptly.

knowledge_base.id: F3F68B55_RE_ Detailed DNEXR CHN SBS SnD on platform_
knowledge_base.problem: Users want to view detailed line items such as 'Carry Out Import' for China's Soybeans Supply and Demand (SND) data on the Oilseeds Dashboard within the platform, similar to what is available via the API.
knowledge_base.solution: The platform has been updated to include the 'Carry Out Import' line item on the Oilseeds SND Dashboard for China. Users can now directly view this detailed monthly data on the dashboard without needing to access the API. For additional line items to be added, users can request them to be included on the dashboard.

knowledge_base.problem: The weekly data for Canadian producer deliveries displayed in the dashboard (SND section) was missing the most recent weeks.
knowledge_base.solution: The dashboard data was updated to include the missing weeks. Additionally, the dataset feeding the dashboard is accessible via an API using the dataset code 'thul-c8f165f1-b946-4f05-ac7e-7ee88a902cd1'. Users can run API queries on this dataset using the provided code to retrieve the relevant data programmatically.

knowledge_base.problem: The user wants to compare current and previous versions of corn trade flows using a script, but the old script no longer works due to changes in tradeflow and forecast code formats.
knowledge_base.solution: Use the updated Python script provided to authenticate and retrieve trade flow data. Key steps include: 1) Authenticate via POST to https://api.dnext.io/dev/auth/custom-login with email, password, and organization to get a Bearer token. 2) Use the updated tradeflow and forecast codes in the format 'thul-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx'. 3) Retrieve the list of tradeflows from https://api.dnext.io/v1.0/fundamentals/tradeflows?old_sharing=true and find the tradeflow_id matching the updated code. 4) List snapshots for the tradeflow using GET https://api.dnext.io/v1.0/fundamentals/tradeflows/{tradeflow_id}/snapshots with parameters. 5) Choose a snapshot from the list. 6) Download and compare tradeflow data by POSTing to https://api.dnext.io/fundamentals/tradeflow/compare with JSON payload specifying code, from snapshot, forecasts, and startMonth. 7) Load the returned URL data into a pandas DataFrame and filter relevant columns. This updated script replaces deprecated code formats and endpoints, ensuring successful retrieval of historical trade flow data.

knowledge_base.problem: User wants to view data split by product in a TradeMatrix aggregation view, specifically to see product data by month combined across all origins and destinations.
knowledge_base.solution: To split data by product in the TradeMatrix aggregation view: 1) Click on the Columns button in the interface. 2) Uncheck the boxes for Destination Group and Destination to remove those splits. 3) Drag and drop the Product field into the Row field area, placing it above the Crop Year field to achieve the desired layout showing product by month with totals. This configuration allows viewing product data aggregated across all origins and destinations.

knowledge_base.id: F7E054BD_RE_ [EXTERNAL] RE_ US planted and harvested estima
knowledge_base.problem: User needs historical USDA acreage estimates (planted and harvested) for US corn, soybeans, wheat, and cotton from 2000 to 2024, including state and national level estimates from March, June, and final USDA surveys. Existing datasets only include corn, soybeans, and wheat, lacking cotton data.
knowledge_base.solution: A dataset with historical data from 1995 is available including corn, soybeans, and wheat (Dataset Code: thul-7431afe6-5b54-11ef-891d-026031473607). Upon request, cotton data was collected and added to the same dataset, covering June, March, and final acreage estimates from 2000 to the latest report. The dataset also expanded corn, wheat, and soybean June acreage data back to 2000. Once cotton data is added, it will be included in future updates and reports automatically. Users can access all this data using the same dataset code.

knowledge_base.id: FB310854_RE_ Unable to download customs data
knowledge_base.problem: Users are unable to download historical customs data because the export button/tab is disabled across various dashboards and countries.
knowledge_base.solution: The export button can be enabled by the platform administrators for specific dashboards and regions. Once enabled, users can download data by following these steps: 1) Navigate to the relevant dashboard (e.g., Argentina dashboard), 2) Click on 'Summarized Data', 3) Select the desired file format, such as '.xlsx (Excel 150,000-row max)', 4) Download the data. Note that not all dashboards may have downloadable data due to copyright restrictions. Administrators should ensure the export feature is enabled for all required regions and countries to allow data export.

knowledge_base.problem: Users are unable to access certain dashboards due to deprecated links and experience changes in dataset download formats where downloads now provide zipped folders containing split dataset chunks instead of single files.
knowledge_base.solution: For dashboard access issues caused by deprecated links, users should use the updated dashboard URLs provided by support, which reflect the current environment and resource identifiers. Regarding dataset downloads, large datasets are now split into multiple CSV files within a zipped folder to facilitate management of large files. To use the dataset, users must download the zipped folder and merge all CSV files together to reconstruct the full dataset. This approach is a permanent change to handle large datasets, and users should be informed to merge files after download. For smaller datasets, improvements are planned to allow single-file downloads.
